articles.title: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma warns of AI's growing impact on social media: ''You won't know if you are talking to a human or a bot'

articles.summary: The rapid emergence and integration of artificial intelligence into digital platforms has sparked significant debates about its impact on online authenticity. Vijay Shekhar Sharma, the founder and CEO of Paytm, recently raised alarms about its potential impact on human-to-human communication.

articles.title: Caixin Explains: How New U.S. AI Export Controls Will Work
articles.author: Caixin Online
articles.summary: The U.S. has introduced sweeping global export restrictions targeting advanced artificial intelligence (AI) computational power. The restrictions are aimed at AI's computational power, not just its raw material and software. It's not clear if they will be implemented in the near future.

articles.title: OpenAI revises policy doc to remove reference to "politically unbiased" AI: report
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: OpenAI has quietly removed language endorsing "politically unbiased" AI from one of its recently published policy documents. In the original draft of its "economic blueprint" for the AI industry in the United States, OpenAI said that AI should aim to be politically unbiased by default.

It's changing the way brands communicate with their audience. It is also changing the nature of advertising.   It is changing the content that brands create.

articles.title: Biden takes big step for the future of AI with ambitious executive order
articles.author: Sarah Parvini
articles.summary: The executive order directs federal agencies to accelerate large-scale AI infrastructure development at government sites. It also directs certain agencies to make federal sites available for AI data centers. The Department of Energy estimated that the electricity needed for data centers in the U.S. tripled over the past decade and is projected to double or triple again by 2028. Developers selected to build on government sites will be required to pay all costs of building and operating AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Biden signs ambitious order to bolster energy resources for AI data centers
articles.author: Sarah Parvini
articles.summary: Biden signed an executive order to accelerate large-scale AI infrastructure development at government sites, while imposing requirements and safeguards on the developers building on those locations. The Department of Energy last month estimated that the electricity needed for data centers in the U.S. tripled over the past decade and is projected to double or triple again by 2028. Some liberal groups say the order doesn't contain sufficient environmental protections.
